concept.title: Share Marketing Cloud Folders and Assets
concept.shortdesc: Share folders and assets between the Marketing Cloud and the Creative Cloud. Collaborate, annotate shared assets, and use them in Marketing Cloud solutions like Social and Target. The shared folder must originate from the Marketing Cloud.

draft-comment.p: Steve Gustaven - testing. Nandini Gupta is the editorial manager and Vikrant Rai is the content lead for CC docs.

section.title: Benefits of Sharing

ul.li: Streamline creative production workflows in the review, approve, and publish phase
Spend less time managing in-process files and versions in multiple locations
Track and manage creative assets more effectively
Easily share, save, and send files between creatives and marketers

section.p: Before Creative Cloud users have access to assets, they must be whitelisted in the Marketing Cloud. See .

section.title: About Asset Sharing with Adobe Target
section.p: When creating activities in Adobe Target, you can use a shared image asset when swapping images in the Content Library.
See Content Library in Target Help.

section.title: About Asset Sharing with Adobe Social
section.p: In Adobe Social, you can insert a shared image asset using the Asset Selector in the Publisher. You can search for a particular folder, browse to it, and attach the asset to a Facebook or Twitter post.
See Publisher Page in Social Help.
Shared folders and assets are synchronized automatically between the clouds.
